intro: Davilla piauhiensis, commonly known as the Piauhy poinsettia, is a species of flowering plant in the Malvaceae family. It is native to Brazil and is characterized by its showy, bright red bracts that resemble poinsettia flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are ovate and often have a velvety texture, while its flowers are small and yellow, clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight.
